results.title: Problem method, using the information
results.creator_credit: Theodore Karp, George L. George and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teacher Education”.
After gathering information to solve the pressure-group problem, the students in a social studies class suggest possible solutions to the problem and with the help of their teacher, develop a set of criteria against which the hypothesis can be tested. Follows the thinking process involved in testing teach hypothesis and in arriving at a solution to the problem. Emphasizes the importance of the use of the problem method in preparing student for democratic living.

results.title: Problem method, defining the problem
results.creator_credit: George L. George and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Teacher Education”.
After becoming aware of pressure groups and their influence on legislation, the students in a social studies class, with the help of their teacher, define and analyse the problem and endeavour to find information upon which to base a satisfactory solution. Shows the procedures employed by the students in fathering and sharing information.

results.title: Problem Drinkers
results.brief_description: The story of what is being done in America to control alcoholism. The film follows, step by step, an alcoholic’s downfall and his eventual rehabilitation.

results.title: Problem clinic
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, ONF | NFB and Ronald Weyman
results.brief_description: Few people, faced with the complicated machinery of the law, know how to proceed without legal counsel or defence. Yet many are unable to pay for the services of a lawyer. The Law Societies of many of the provinces, encouraged by the Canadian Bar Association, extend help in the form of free legal-aid clinics staffed by volunteer lawyers. Enacted here is a case in which a young man facing a criminal charge is defended by a legal-aid lawyer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicholas Balla, ONF | NFB and Ronald Weyman

results.title: Probing the continental margin
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Greg Reading
results.brief_description: Describes the techniques of coring, trailing and seismic sounding used by scientists to survey and explore the mineral content of undersea landforms around Australia’s continental margin.

results.title: Probation officer
results.creator_credit: Donald Alexander, Data Film Productions and J.B. Holmes
results.brief_description: A study of the cast cope of duties which Probation Officers are called upon to perform; the case of a young girl is presented. Because she is unhappy at home, she seeks satisfaction elsewhere, gets into bad company and is convicted of stealing. Through the understanding and help of the Probation Officer, he girl’s home life is improved, and the girl is put on probation instead of being sent to gaol. The purpose of the film is to encourage recruitment of suitable people to the probation service; their training is shown , and the necessary educational requirements indicated.

results.title: Probability 2
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series is a continuation of “Probability 1” (see 309029) and covers the areas of; formulas for finding permutations of n, probability of two mutually exclusive events and two independent events. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: Probability 1 : counting techniques
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Associates and ACCESS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics for modern living”.
This episode from the “Mathematics for modern living” series introduces the concepts of chance and probability through examples of everyday life. It discusses games of chance and everyday space, closely followed by counting techniques. Suitable for lower to middle secondary level students. A study guide accompanies this tape.
